subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Can We Post Msgs In QuikScript?
msgSnippet: Hello All, It pretty easy, just compose your message as HTML and set the fond to Jerome ot another QS font and type away. As long as the people receiving the
messageBody:
Hello All,
 
It pretty easy, just compose your message as HTML and set the fond to Jerome ot another QS font and type away. As long as the people receiving the message has the same font or font group, they'll see your e-mail as QS. The Yahoo Group system supports HTML and fonts.
 
Chuck Peck
 

From: x1skycycle [mailto:x1skycycle@...]
Sent: Saturday, September 04, 2004 11:50 AM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Can We Post Msgs In QuikScript?

Chuck Peck knows how to do it. (see message #548)
Go on Chuck, tell us how you did it!

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "jeff_smith_8992" <jeff_smith_8992@y...> wrote:
> This is probably
dumb question but since I don't know the answer, I'll
> ask it
anyway...
>
> I was under the impression that Yahoo eGroups
messages could only be
> written in pure ascii text, and that it would
ignore any text
> formatting.  And that's why our messages on this
forum aren't written
> in QuikScript fonts.  But I happened to be
skimming through some of
> the old messages in the archives and I noticed
that there are several
> that properly display QuikScript text (see
messages #9 and #18 from
> Jon Zuck).  But then there are others that
don't display properly (see
> msg #176).
>
> So my question
is can we post messages to this group in QuikScript?
> Is there some
secret method?  Or did Yahoo change something that now
> prevents
formatted text?
>
> Thanks,
> Jeff

Hello All,
 
It pretty easy, just compose your message as HTML and set the fond to Jerome
ot another QS font and type away. As long as the people receiving the
message has the same font or font group, they'll see your e-mail as QS. The
Yahoo Group system supports HTML and fonts.
 
Chuck Peck
 


  _____

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "jeff_smith_8992"
<jeff_smith_8992@y...> wrote:
> This is probably dumb question but since I don't know the answer, I'll
> ask it anyway...
> 
> I was under the impression that Yahoo eGroups messages could only be
> written in pure ascii text, and that it would ignore any text
> formatting.  And that's why our messages on this forum aren't written
> in QuikScript fonts.  But I happened to be skimming through some of
> the old messages in the archives and I noticed that there are several
> that properly display QuikScript text (see messages #9 and #18 from
> Jon Zuck).  But then there are others that don't display properly (see
> msg #176).
> 
> So my question is can we post messages to this group in QuikScript? 
> Is there some secret method?  Or did Yahoo change something that now
> prevents formatted text?
> 
> Thanks,
> Jeff
